titles.title: Utah West Desert Land Exchange Act of 2000
Utah West Desert Land Exchange Act of 2000
Utah West Desert Land Exchange Act of 2000
To provide for the exchange of certain lands within the State of Utah.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4579.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-463.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 910.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/11/2000--Passed House amended. Utah West Desert Land Exchange Act of 2000 - Ratifies the "Agreement for Exchange of Lands West Desert State-Federal Land Consolidation" (an agreement between the State of Utah and the United States to exchange certain Federal lands and mineral interests in Utah for lands and mineral interests of approximately equal value managed by the Utah School and Institutional Trust Lands Administration within wilderness study areas in the West Desert region of Utah) and sets forth the obligations of the United States, the State, and the Administration as a matter of Federal law. Sets forth requirements concerning the determination of, and adjustments for achieving, approximately equal value.
